definition: (lit.) past years' almanac/(fig.) ancient history/obsolete practice/old-fashioned principle

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
old variant of 曆|历[li4]/old variant of 歷|历[li4]
to look to the past for guidance (idiom)

sentences.english: So you thought you had no use for Latin in this modern age?
sentences.chinese: 这是什么年头，学拉丁文这些老皇历是没用的？

definition: variant of 黄曆|黄历[huang2 li5]
old calendar/the Chinese lunar calendar/same as 農曆|农历[nong2 li4]
lit. stale grain, overcooked sesame (idiom); fig. the same boring old gossip
pinyin: chen2 gu3 zi5 lan4 zhi1 ma5

definition: a real man doesn't boast about his past achievements (idiom)
pinyin: hao3 han4 bu4 ti2 dang1 nian2 yong3

definition: to swallow ancient learning without digesting it (idiom)/to be pedantic without having a mastery of one's subject
to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
